item.title: I wish GPT4 had never happened
item.description: N/A.

item.title: Why human societies developed so little during 300k years
item.description: The article discusses anthropologist Napoleon Chagnon's findings on Yanomamö warfare and their unique cultural practices that kept populations down while having abundant resources.

item.title: The Garbage Collection Handbook, 2nd Edition
item.description: The Garbage Collection Handbook, 2nd Edition updates the state of automatic memory management research and development, with a focus on the latest advanced techniques, like parallel, incremental, concurrent, and real-time garbage collection, and their implications for garbage collector designers and implementers.

item.title: New Orleans teenagers found a new proof of the Pythagorean Theorem
item.description: Two teenage girls have presented a new proof of the Pythagorean Theorem to the American Mathematical Society, creating quite a stir.

item.title: Do judges give out tougher sentences when hungry? A study too good to be true
item.description: N/A.

item.title: Everything advertised on social media is overpriced junk
item.description: A study by Carnegie Mellon and Pamplin College found that targeted ads on social media cost an average of 10% more and come from vendors with poor ratings, leading the study to conclude that all advertised products on social media are overpriced junk.

item.title: Go port of SQLite without CGo
item.description: N/A

item.title: Why & How We Retired Elm at Culture Amp
item.description: Culture Amp has retired Elm as its preferred language for new front-end code after four years despite its previous promotion by the company's engineering lead.

item.title: FAA K-12 Airport Design Challenge in Minecraft
item.description: The FAA Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math Aviation and Space Education (STEM AVSED) Program is organizing an Airport Design Challenge in Minecraft for students in grades K-12.

item.title: Google to Ban Financial Lending Apps from Accessing User Photos, Contacts
item.description: Google has updated its personal loans policy to prevent apps that offer loans from accessing user contacts or photos.

item.title: Go 1.21 will (likely) have a static toolchain on Linux
item.description: The upcoming version of Go 1.21 will have a static toolchain on Linux, which means that the compiler will be built using the pure Go resolver only and will be a static executable, unless the developers revert for some reason.

item.title: Electricity Prices by Country
item.description: The article delves into the cost and sources of electricity across countries, revealing how Germany and Bermuda are the most expensive while Sudan, Venezuela, and Iran are the cheapest.

item.title: 0x0: Share Files from Terminal
item.description: Online file-sharing service 0x0 has been taken offline after German police seized its servers.

item.title: Iran installs cameras in public places to identify, penalise unveiled women
item.description: Iran is installing cameras in public places to identify and penalise unveiled women who do not comply with the compulsory dress code.

item.title: A 1.5GB string
item.description: The author describes how, during their previous role, they discovered a significant memory waste in a Java service they supported.

item.title: Paul Graham is an investor in the company trying to kill Twitter
item.description: Paul Graham's investment fund, Y Combinator, invested in a start-up called Tilde, which is working on a decentralized, open-source alternative to Twitter called Mastodon.

item.title: FCC warns Portland church to shut down pirate FM operating under its steeple
item.description: The Federal Communications Commission (FCC) has alerted the Eastside Free Methodist Church, based in Portland, that an unlicensed FM radio station, operating on 90.5 FM, has been identified to be operating under its steeple.

item.title: GNU+Linux laptops with Libreboot preinstalled, based on coreboot
item.description: Minifree Ltd sells GNU+Linux laptops with Libreboot, a BIOS/UEFI replacement based on Coreboot, pre-installed, with encrypted Debian GNU+Linux OS and full driver support; it also offers options for other Linux distros or BSD.

item.title: Chasing Rainbows: Designing for Colorblindness
item.description: "The Verge" article discusses designing for colorblindness and calls attention to the fact that the world was not designed for people with colorblindness.

item.title: To Supercharge Learning, Look to Play
item.description: Play and the arts are vital for learning, building the '6 C's' of collaboration, communication, content, critical thinking, creative innovation, and confidence.

item.title: Show HN: BrowserBox – do stuff with browsers that you can't normally
item.description: BrowserBox is a remote, isolated browser API that can be run on the cloud or self-hosted, with a regular and Pro version available.

item.title: Pydantic V2 rewritten in Rust is 5-50x faster than Pydantic V1
item.description: Pydantic V2, with a rewritten pydantic-core, is 5-50x faster and more maintainable than Pydantic V1.

item.title: AI powered realtime fluid simulations are here
item.description: A developer tested an AI-powered fluid simulation tool for adding realistic, interactive smoke to a game, comparing EmberGen and Zibra Smoke & Fire.

item.title: Custom Allocators in Rust
item.description: NicalIndex discusses custom allocators in Rust for improved memory allocation strategies, enabling different parts of a program to choose strategies.

item.title: The Erosion of Free Will: Why Society's Loss of Belief in Freedom Is Dangerous
item.description: Luke Burgis argues that the erosion of society's belief in freedom and free will is becoming increasingly dangerous, especially in Silicon Valley, and has ethical implications for political systems and human behavior.

item.title: Show HN: Learn Rust 101 – A guide to aid your journey of becoming a Rustacean
item.description: The "learn-rust-101" guide on GitHub is a comprehensive resource for learning Rust, a popular programming language, with milestones for learning various concepts.

item.title: Trashcan – web based service for indexing scientific papers, or other documents
item.description: N/A.

item.title: Show HN: Spotify streaming GDPR dump local analyzer
item.description: N/A.

item.title: Hacking Google ReCAPTCHA v3 Using Reinforcement Learning (2019)
item.description: Researchers have developed a reinforcement learning methodology to bypass Google's reCAPTCHA v3.

item.title: Ex-S.F. fire commissioner with fractured skull after metal pipe attack
item.description: Former San Francisco fire commissioner, Don Carmignani, was hospitalized with a fractured skull and 51 stitches after being attacked with a metal object while leaving his mother's house in the Marina District.
